ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] LIZARDS ARE CUTE
ygData.msgSnippet: No support at all?  What the heck are they thinking! I know I play doing the days and have a lot of folks from outside the US to group with, and I hate those
ygData.messageBody:
No support at all? What the heck are they thinking!

I know I play doing the days and have a lot of folks from outside the
US to group with, and I hate those down times. They don't even tell
us anymore when they are going to be. *Rant Rant Rant*

You would think with as many folks that play EQ they would get their
act together.

Ok I'm done now ranting.

Ranalla

Tharca An Tay wrote:
>
> I am living in Europe, the Netherlands. Didnt receive my copy either,
> although I ordered the very first day. Yesterday I tried to call the 888
> number to check my order and guess what? Its a USA-only free of charge
> number, not accessable from outside the USA.
> Like with the GM hours and the downtimes (which is always during primetime
> for Europe) this proves again that Varant totally ignores their European
> customers. We pay as much as any of the others but we dont have any support
> whatsoever.
> I wonder if I will get my refund. I wonder if I get my CD.
> I even wonder if it wont spoil my gamefun.
>
> Tharca/Keshia/Elyane/Nastyi/Naomi/Chanti on The Tribunal
>
> (hehehe...yes I know I have a lot of chars, but hey..I love them all )
>
> >From: Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ_women@egroups.com
> >To: EQ_women@egroups.com
> >Subject: Re: [EQ_women] LIZARDS ARE CUTE
> >Date: Tue, 25 Apr 2000 12:14:20 -0700
> >
> >LOL, Rose. I even went to Comp USA today, since it was to hit retail
> >shelves. HAHAHAHA!!! Nope, they haven't gotten THEIR order in either
> >;-(. The good news is I FINALLY got all the way through to getting to
> >hold at the 800 number. This after 3 days of calling, once getting
> >through to be told "everyone will get their order" and then hung up on.
> >
> >Oh, and just called. They have no record of my order. However, I
> >cannot order again because I've already ordered and no, the shipping
> >company people can't do anything, I have to call Sony. But, of course,
> >Sony can't do anything I have to call the shipping company.
> >
> >Sorry, this IS a rant. I have had a lot of respect for Verant in the
> >past, but the way they have handled Kunark is totally and completely
> >unacceptable. A valuable lesson in how NOT to handle customer support.
> >
> >Ice
> >
> >Rose M Glass wrote:
> >
> > >
> > > I have yet to see one. Have not gotten my CD yet, *looks out the door
> > >
> > > to see if the UPS guy has spawned*
